gotcha lol research is good..my husband says I'm alittle anal when it come =
to that.. I just hate=C2=A0buying something then reading later that it was =
crap or there was=C2=A0something better UGH!! LOL

com
Date: Wednesday, December 15, 2010, 11:26 PM


=C2=A0 



Yes, that's w=
hy I asked if anyone had used these cameras. Trying to research before maki=
ng the purchase. I understand what Sharon was saying about the Moditronics =
camera.

Thanks,
Draiga

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ursula Kalin <kali=
nu@...> wrote:
>
> well clearly I'm alittle bias...but if you ask around an=
yone will tell it is not a full spectrum camera,it does have it good point =
but spectercam is really the only full spec camera without paying a arm and=
 a leg. I was recommened the cam by Andy from the other group and he works =
i some sort of engineer. But I can only suggest.So I hope your happy with y=
our choice. The specterCam is has motion censer. They work on a SD card fro=
m your DVR..so thats no big deal what matter is weather it is trully a full=
 specter cam. I was going with that brand myself until I researched the pro=
duct..I never Jump abd buy anything without checking out reviews and such.Y=
our going to need another like source with this."Moditronics' so-called "Fu=
ll Spectrum" (which I've dubbed "Duo-Spectrum" because it only sees into th=
e near UV and IR spectrums"Please make sure you understand what sharon is s=
aying...this is NOT a full spectrum cam...if your happy with that go for it=
 :). You
> will get better result with a full spectrum...and if you can get=
 one why settle for less. But thats just the sorta person i am.
> 
> --- On=
 Wed, 12/15/10, draiga1 <mail@...> wrote:
> 
> 
> From: draiga1 <mail@...>
=
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Full Spectrum Cameras
> To: EVP-ITC@...=
m
> Date: Wednesday, December 15, 2010, 12:11 PM
> 
> 
> =C3=82=C2=A0 
> 
>=
 
> 
> Thank you so much, Sharon. I was hoping someone had the moditronics =
camera too. It sounds like it works great for what I want. I appreciate you=
 sharing your results with it.
> 
> Thanks!
> Draiga
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com, "mllejade" <leongbabe@> wrote:
> >
> > Hello Ursula and Drai=
ga,
> > 
> > From my experience with all kinds of cameras, I say it's best =
to experiment. On one of my experiments, I went to a purported haunted alle=
y and took 4 different shots using 4 different cameras from the same angle,=
 taking the photos one after the other within a minute's span. The 4 camera=
s I used were: 1. Moditronics' so-called "Full Spectrum" (which I've dubbed=
 "Duo-Spectrum" because it only sees into the near UV and IR spectrums, exc=
luding the visible spectrum altogether) and 2. Moditronics "Deep IR" which =
only sees into the IR spectrum, excluding the visible and UV spectrums, 3. =
a "Full Spectrum" camera, which sees all 3 spectrums (i.e., UV, visible and=
 IR) and 4. a regular digital point n' shoot consumer camera. The results w=
ere interesting. In the pictures I shot with Moditronics' Full ("Duo") Spec=
trum camera and "Deep IR" camera, I got a face floating in a fire escape fr=
om the side of a building adjoining the alley; that face did not show up on=

> neither the full spectrum camera nor on the point n' shoot camera. Inter=
esting indeed. I intend to carry on with more experiments of this type, i.e=
., shooting the same scene using multiple cameras with different capabiliti=
es. BTW, as you may already know, the Moditronics camera takes stills as we=
ll as video, and it records onto SD cards. 
> > 
> > Ursula, thanks for you=
r review on the SpecterCam 3, which I'll definitely look into purchasing. I=
n the past I've purchase accessories from the SpecterCam site and the site'=
s owner is definitely very knowledgeable. My philosophy is that we know so =
little about this research is that I may as well try it all (if I could aff=
ord it, that is).
> > 
> > Draiga - if you decide to make videos with one o=
f the SpecterCam cameras, and you want sound, be sure you also have a digit=
al voice recorder running at the same time as DVR cameras record only image=
s, and not sound. Also, about Moditronics' full spectrum and deep IR camera=
s, you'll need an external light source if you film at night since those ca=
meras do not see into the visible spectrum and if it's a pitch black or ver=
y dark environment, they won't see anyhing without a light source. However,=
 they're perfect for daytime ghost hunting, which I do as well as night-tim=
e investigations (I don't believe that ghosts only come out and show themse=
lves at night).
> > 
> > Hope that helps. When I find time, I will post the=
 photos from my alley experiment.
> > 
> > Sharon from SF
> > 
> >
>
